hanzi-su-wiki:
貧

Значения

Бедный, скудный

Мнемоника

Швыряться 分 деньгами 貝, беднеть.

Варианты

贫
purpleculture_pinyin:
pín
poor; inadequate; deficient; garrulous
бедные; неадекватный; дефицитный; болтливый
rtega_mnemonic:
貧貧RS
贫贫		poor, impoverished, needy
  • RS. separated from 分 money 貝
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 贫)
Antonyms: 富
Ideographic: Money 貝 that must be split 分; 分 also provides the pronunciation
purpleculture_examples:
貧困 [ pín kùn ]: impoverished; poverty
貧窮 [ pín qióng ]: poor; impoverished
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿱ Above to below
    • 分 [ fēn ] to divide, to allocate; fraction; small unit of time or other quantity
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
heisig_chinese_memo: In the case of true poverty (impoverished), not having money is only part of the problem. There are other components as well, like lack of education, class structuring, etc., but that doesn't really matter. Just remember that the money is only part of it, not the whole.
heisig_constituent: poverty, part, eight, sword, dagger, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
koohiiStory1: In the case of true poverty, not having money is only part of the problem. There are other components as well, like lack of education, class structuring, etc., but that doesn´t really matter. Just remember that the money is only part of it, not the whole.
koohiiStory2: Parting with your money will lead to poverty.
jp_example_words:
貧困(ひんこん): poverty, lack
貧弱(ひんじゃく): poor, meagre, insubstantial
貧乏(びんぼう): poverty, destitute, poor
貧しい(まずしい): poor, needy
jp_readingExamples: 貧富 (ひんぷ), 貧弱 (ひんじゃく), 清貧 (せいひん), 貧しい (まず.しい)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Those that can only eat a part of a shellfish are probably a bit poor.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Poor people can't even afford a whole shellfish. They have to settle with just a part.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: And since they are poor, they are getting these shellfish parts from the trash bin (びん). It's quite unfortunate.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine a poor person going through a garbage bin to find only a part of of a shellfish. What a sad sight.
Ru_Radicals: ハ, 刀 (катана), 目 (глаз), 貝 (раковина)
Ru_trainchinese:
pín: (графема) бедный, нищий; недоставать, не хватать; термин, который используется монахами или монахинями для скромного упоминания о себе
pín: (прил) (диал.) болтливый, говорливый, разговорчивый
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you divide (分) the shellfish (貝) among the poor
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: If impoverished you only get a small part of the clams that some people earn.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " Bei ", from " Fen ", " Fen " also sounds. The original meaning is poverty and lack of money. "Shuowen": "Poor, poor wealth." It means that wealth is reduced due to division. "Jade articles. Beibu": "Poor, lack of wealth." Such as "Shangshu. "Hong Fan" "Four Years of Poverty", "Confucianism": "Stuck in Money." "History. "The Family of Prime Minister Chen": "(Chen Ping) was poor when he was young, and he was good at school. He had 30 acres of land and lived alone with his brother." "Mawangdui Silk Book. Said" Line 158: "The land has [wealth] without worrying about the poverty of the people."

" Poverty " as a verb means to make it poor. Such as "Zhuangzi. Great Master: "The sky is selfless, and the earth is selfless. How can the world be private and poor for me?" "Xunzi. "Tian Lun": "Strengthen the foundation and save the use, then the sky cannot be poor."

" Poverty " is often opposed to " rich " in ancient books, such as "The Analects. "Xue Er": "Poor without flattery, rich without arrogance." It means poverty without flattery (others), rich without arrogance. "tube. "Eight Views": "Walk through the mountains, observe the mulberry and hemp, count the production of the six animals, and the rich and poor countries can know."

Although both " poor " and " poor " have the meaning of lack of money, poverty and poverty, they have different meanings in the early literature. " Poor " refers to lack of money, while " poor " refers to bad luck and unwillingness. "Zuo Zhuan. "The Fourteenth Year of the Zhaogong": "Split the poor and revitalize the poor", Kong Yingda Shu: "Generally poor, poor are similar; the poor are the poor. The poor have little goods and wealth; poverty means no livelihood." Therefore " poor " and " rich " "In contrast, " poor " is opposite to " da ". Such as "Zhuangzi. "De Chong Fu": "Survival from death, poor to rich, bad reputation, hunger and thirst, cold and heat, is the change of things, the destiny." " Poor " is often used in conjunction with " poverty ", and later a lack of money, The meaning of poverty.

" Poverty " implies lack and insufficiency. "Guang Yun. "True Rhyme": "Poverty, lack, and lack." Such as "Wen Xin Diao Long. "Practicing calligraphy": "Those who are good at writing are rich in ten thousand articles, but poor in one word." Qing Dynasty Zheng Xie "Huai She Di Mo": "A body is like continuous branches, the leaves and leaves depend on each other; the tree has big branches and rich leaves, but small trees Poor branches and leaves."

" Poor " later became the self-humility words of monks, nuns, and Taoists, such as "poor monks" and "poor nuns". "Journey to the West" Chapter 12: "The poor monk is not talented, I would like to do the work of a dog and horse, and ask your majesty for the truth, and pray for the eternal life of our king." "The Romance of the Gods" Chapter 12: "The poor way is dry Taiyi in Jinguangdong, Yuanshan is the real person."
humanum_short_description_en: From " Bei ", from " Fen ", " Fen " also sounds. The original meaning is poverty and lack of money, as opposed to " rich ".
humanum_full_description:
從「貝」，從「分」，「分」亦聲。本義是貧窮、缺少錢財。《說文》：「貧，財分少也。」意謂錢財因分割而減少。《玉篇．貝部》：「貧，乏財也。」如《尚書．洪範》「四曰貧」，《孔傳》：「困於財。」《史記．陳丞相世家》：「（陳平）少時家貧，好讀書，有田三十畝，獨與兄伯居。」《馬王堆帛書．稱》158行：「地有【財】而不憂民之貧也。」

　　「貧」作動詞表示使之貧窮。如《莊子．大宗師》：「天無私覆，地無私載，天地豈私貧我哉？」《荀子．天論》：「彊本而節用，則天不能貧。」

　　「貧」在古書中常與「富」相對，如《論語．學而》：「貧而無諂，富而無驕。」意謂貧窮而不奉承（他人），富貴而不傲慢。《管子．八觀》：「行其山澤，觀其桑麻，計其六畜之產，而貧富之國可知也。」

　　「貧」和「窮」雖然都有缺少錢財、貧苦困乏的意思，但兩者在早期文獻中的意義有區別。「貧」指缺少錢財，而「窮」則指際遇不好、不得志。《左傳．昭公十四年》：「分貧振窮」，孔穎達疏：「大體貧、窮相類；細言窮困於貧。貧者家少貨財；窮謂全無生業。」故「貧」與「富」相對，而「窮」與「達」相對。如《莊子．德充符》：「死生存亡，窮達貧富，賢與不肖毀譽，飢渴寒暑，是事之變，命之行也。」「窮」因常與「貧」連用，後來才產生缺少錢財、窮困的意思。

　　「貧」引申表示缺少、不足。《廣韻．真韻》：「貧，乏也，少也。」如《文心雕龍．練字》：「故善為文者，富於萬篇，貧於一字。」清代鄭燮〈懷舍弟墨〉：「一身若連枝，葉葉相依因；樹大枝葉富，樹小枝葉貧。」

　　「貧」後來又成為僧侶、尼姑、道士的自謙之辭，如「貧僧」、「貧尼」等。《西遊記》第12回：「貧僧不才，願效犬馬之勞，與陛下求取真經，祈保我王江山永固。」《封神演義》第12回：「貧道乃乾元山金光洞太乙真人是也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「貝」，從「分」，「分」亦聲。本義是貧窮、缺少錢財，與「富」相對。

  • ⿱ Above to below

①窮，收入少，生活困難，與“富”相對：貧窮。貧寒。貧民。清貧。
②缺乏，不足：貧乏。貧血。貧瘠。
③絮煩可厭：貧相(xiàng)。貧氣(ａ．絮煩可厭；b．行動態度不大方。“氣”均讀輕聲)。
④僧道謙稱：貧道。貧僧。
⑤窮富。

貧窮 [ pín qióng ]: poor; impoverished

貧困(ひんこん): poverty, lack
貧弱(ひんじゃく): poor, meagre, insubstantial
貧乏(びんぼう): poverty, destitute, poor
貧しい(まずしい): poor, needy

從「 貝 」，從「 分 」，「 分 」亦聲。本義是貧窮、缺少錢財。《說文》：「貧，財分少也。」意謂錢財因分割而減少。《玉篇．貝部》：「貧，乏財也。」如《尚書．洪範》「四曰貧」，《孔傳》：「困於財。」《史記．陳丞相世家》：「（陳平）少時家貧，好讀書，有田三十畝，獨與兄伯居。」《馬王堆帛書．稱》158行：「地有【財】而不憂民之貧也。」 「 貧 」作動詞表示使之貧窮。如《莊子．大宗師》：「天無私覆，地無私載，天地豈私貧我哉？」《荀子．天論》：「彊本而節用，則天不能貧。」 「 貧 」在古書中常與「 富 」相對，如《論語．學而》：「貧而無諂，富而無驕。」意謂貧窮而不奉承（他人），富貴而不傲慢。《管子．八觀》：「行其山澤，觀其桑麻，計其六畜之產，而貧富之國可知也。」 「 貧 」和「 窮 」雖然都有缺少錢財、貧苦困乏的意思，但兩者在早期文獻中的意義有區別。「 貧 」指缺少錢財，而「 窮 」則指際遇不好、不得志。《左傳．昭公十四年》：「分貧振窮」，孔穎達疏：「大體貧、窮相類；細言窮困於貧。貧者家少貨財；窮謂全無生業。」故「 貧 」與「 富 」相對，而「 窮 」與「 達 」相對。如《莊子．德充符》：「死生存亡，窮達貧富，賢與不肖毀譽，飢渴寒暑，是事之變，命之行也。」「 窮 」因常與「 貧 」連用，後來才產生缺少錢財、窮困的意思。 「 貧 」引申表示缺少、不足。《廣韻．真韻》：「貧，乏也，少也。」如《文心雕龍．練字》：「故善為文者，富於萬篇，貧於一字。」清代鄭燮〈懷舍弟墨〉：「一身若連枝，葉葉相依因；樹大枝葉富，樹小枝葉貧。」 「 貧 」後來又成為僧侶、尼姑、道士的自謙之辭，如「貧僧」、「貧尼」等。《西遊記》第12回：「貧僧不才，願效犬馬之勞，與陛下求取真經，祈保我王江山永固。」《封神演義》第12回：「貧道乃乾元山金光洞太乙真人是也。」

貧字的基本解释

貧
pín
见“贫”。

貧字的汉语字典释义

[①]［pín］
［《廣韻》符巾切，平真，並。］
“贫1”的繁体字。
(1)缺少财物，贫困。与“富”相对。
(2)贫民；贫家。
(3)使贫穷。
(4)指以为贫穷。
(5)匮乏；不足。
(6)絮烦可厌。
(7)自称的谦词。参见“貧道”、“貧僧”、“貧尼”。

貧字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　貧； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页1205第10
〔古文〕?【唐韻】符巾切【集韻】【韻會】皮巾切【正韻】毗賔切，?音頻。【說文】財分少也。【爾雅·釋言】寠，貧也。【註】謂貧陋。【疏】貧者，無財也。【書·洪範】六極，四曰貧。【傳】困於財。【詩·邶風】終寠且貧。【晉語】韓宣子憂貧，叔向賀之。　又【韻補】叶頻眠切，音騈。【歐陽修·送魏主簿詩】士欲見所守，視其居賤貧。何用慰離居，贈子以短篇。

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

貧字的起名意思

暂无。

poor
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［pín］
["Guangyun" Fu towel cut, plain, and. ]
The traditional characters of "Poor 1".
(1) Lack of property, poverty. Contrast with "rich".
(2) The poor; the poor.
(3) Make poor.
(4) It means to be poor.
(5) Lack; insufficient.
(6) Annoyance is boring.
(7) Self-proclaimed modest words. See "poor way", "poor monk", "poor nun".
poor
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Unitary Collection] [Beijing Department] 　Poverty; Kangxi Strokes: 11; Page Number: Page 1205 No. 10
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] Fu towel cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Leather towel cut [Zheng Yun] Adjacent to the bladder cut, audio. [Said the text] You have less money. 【Erya·Interpretation】Liu, poor. [Note] It is poor. 【Sparse】The poor have no money. 【Book·Hong Fan】Six poles, four say poverty. [Biography] Difficulty in wealth. 【Poetry·Bei Feng】Endless and poor. [Jin Chinese] Han Xuanzi is poor, and his uncle Xiang Hezhi.　[Rhyme Supplement] Ye Pinmian cuts, sound 騈. [Ouyang Xiu·Send Wei Zhu's Poems] Scholars want to see what they are guarding, and regard them as low and poor. Why use comfort to live away, give the child a short story.

Name meaning

pín
вм. 贫
Radicals: 分, 貝  (part, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
Those that can only eat a part of a shellfish are probably a bit poor.
Poor people can't even afford a whole shellfish. They have to settle with just a part.
Reading Mnemonic
And since they are poor, they are getting these shellfish parts from the trash bin (びん). It's quite unfortunate.
Imagine a poor person going through a garbage bin to find only a part of of a shellfish. What a sad sight.
